data.text: @kerpen @mattjcan You might want to compare a country that actually HAS a universal medical system and not one that has the poor overrepresented in flu deaths because they literally can't afford care. The difference here is that covid is funded for everyone and has high vaccination rates...
@kerpen I trust the CDC as much as ISIS now!
Even with that potential methodological bias, the pediatric IFR for COVID is lower than influenza using CDC burden estimates for both. https://t.co/xW3VssJmc6
@kerpen At least that’s what they are trying to convince you of.  If it’s a man made virus it’s the scientists’ who funded it that’s killed these people.  Don’t get it twisted.

The closest we can get to apples-to-apples would be to use the burden estimates for both influenza and COVID -- but there is a bias, because they use the (overascertained) NCHS count as a floor instead of running the straight statistical model for COVID.
https://t.co/DT1iHtBpO9 https://t.co/ahay3SRsf3
@kerpen Another mic drop on that hack.
